title: [Locksmehr River, Encampment]
description: Situated at the very edge of the frozen river, the small clearing is a combination of gravel and tufts of dead grass mixed into the snow.  A snow-lined gravel trail leads down to the water's edge where dried river reeds bend amid round stones edged by unmoving water.  Set back from the walking space, a domed sinew and hide tent and a birch bark-sided hut have been built among the sassafras and hickory.

Situated at the very edge of the partially frozen river, the small clearing is a combination of gravel and tufts of broken grass blades.  A snow-lined gravel trail leads down to the water's edge where river reeds grow amid round stones worn smooth by the flowing water.  Set back from the walking space, a birch bark-sided hut has been built among the sassafras and hickory.
